sub_title: Global Tech Lead - Digital Workplace & Employee Experience
summary:
I'm an energetic and result-driven Tech leader with 10+ years of experience in Information Technology, Digital Services & Experience, and Program Management, known for my ability to bring business and Tech teams on board, taking initiative and getting work done effectively. 

I am a very proactive individual with a strong sense of responsibility. I have lived in Brazil, USA, Argentina and Netherlands and have traveled, worked and volunteered in 40+ countries. Throughout the past years, I have learnt how to plan and execute complex digital transformations by steering on strategic visions, fostering strong & safe team environments, capitalizing on people's strengths and building strong relationships with stakeholders which made me thrive in diverse teams across the world.

awards.description: CCID stands for Community College for International Development. A program from the Fulbright Commission to send talented students from around the world to study in United States of America and take back what they learn to develop their countries by building global relationships that strengthen educational programs, and promote economic development.

projects.title: AIESEC Iberoamerican Leadership Congress 2014, Mexico City, Mexico
projects.description:
Roles and Responsibilities:
‣ Short-term contract to project manage a global youth conference held in Mexico City with 300 young leaders from 20 Latin-American countries and over 10 corporate partners.
‣ Directly managed a team of 3 associate project managers supporting sponsor deliverables, 6 special events, PR, logistics, health and safety, budget management, delegate experience and co-managed a team of 50 people.

Description:
‣ This conference joins more than 300 young people from Iberian-Latin America to share ideas on sustainable development, leadership, organizational culture and current world issues but specially to create working strategies to solve those issues and, at the same time, keep AIESEC's growth and development. 

‣ Within 7 days, several conferences and workshops will address issues such as youth problems, leadership, world problems and its solutions, local committees' sharing, success cases and experiences to improve results. All of this under an international environment surrounded by accents and sensations from all over the world that ease young people's development. This will also be a great opportunity for entrepreneurs and corporations to gain access to AIESEC's young talent and a position in talented AIESECer's radar.

contributors.headline: Global Tech Lead - Digital Workplace & Employee Experience

projects.title: AIESEC Global Leaders' Summit 2014, Guangzhou, China.
projects.description:
Roles and Responsibilities: 
‣ As Global CIO of AIESEC International, I attended, led and delivered AIESEC’s International Congress with the AIESEC International 12-13 Team. 

Description:
‣ This event brings 300 young leaders from 110 countries and successful leaders from business world to discus about world relevant topics, lifelong learning concept as the best way for youth and leadership development. 
‣ It also brings together the top leaders of AIESEC, to discuss and decide the global strategy for the upcoming term.

contributors.headline: Global Tech Lead - Digital Workplace & Employee Experience

projects.title: AIESEC's International Congress 2013, Sharm El Sheikh, Egypt
projects.description:
Roles and Responsibilities:
‣ Led the Agenda/program development of 14 days Global Congress for 800 delegates from 110 countries in Sharm El Sheikh, Egypt.
‣ Coordinated a team consists of 21 internationals facilitators 
‣ Communication and alignment with an organizing committee consists of 85 internationals.
‣ Coordinated and managed Project Managers and Conference Chairs

Description:
‣AIESEC International Congress 2013, or "IC 2013" was the 65th global annual congress/meeting of AIESEC. It brings together the top leaders of AIESEC, to discuss and decide the global strategy for the upcoming term. IC 2013 had 750 delegates from 125 countries/ territories, and lasted 12 days. It took place in Sharm El Sheikh, Egypt.

Achievement: 95% satisfaction of delegates

projects.title: AIESEC's International Congress 2012, Russia, Moscow
projects.description:
Roles and Responsibilities: 
‣ As Global CIO of AIESEC International, I attended, led and delivered AIESEC’s International Congress with the AIESEC International 12-13 Team. 

Description:
‣AIESEC’s International Congress is an annual leadership summit that brings together young leaders of national AIESEC brunches, global and national partners’ representatives and virtual participants. It’s the biggest event AIESEC has in its educational cycle, where participants gather together to plan joint projects in economic and social sphere, based on global internships program and according to global community requests.

AIESEC's International Congress 2012 brought together young leaders from 110 countries in Moscow, Russia.

Result: 96% satisfaction of delegates

contributors.headline: Global Tech Lead - Digital Workplace & Employee Experience

profile_positions.description: Accountable for delivering the technology for digital workplace services and digital employee experience to 60.000 employees in 40+ countries.
profile_positions.title: Global Tech Lead - Digital Workplace & Employee Experience

profile_positions.description:
‣ 	Lead of a global team including 20+ engineers, a global help desk comprised of 400 engineers and local support teams
‣ 	Lead of data engineering and business intelligence for digital workplace 
‣ 	End responsible for ensuring 24/7 service support to 52 000 colleagues in over 40 countries
‣ 	Support major incidents resolution including liaising with internal stakeholders, resolving with vendors within SLAs and senior management communication
‣ 	Perform service health checks and evaluate global user satisfaction reports to ensure best customer experience, continuous service improvement and product enhancement 
‣ 	Responsible for the development of team members and facilitate the One Agile Way of Working and mindset
profile_positions.title: Global IT Area Lead - Digital Workplace

profile_positions.description:
‣ 	Worked as strategic advisor and counsel to senior IT leaders in various areas such as operational support, internal and external communication and interaction with Board of Directors.
‣ 	Lead day-to-day responsibility for projects and tasks such as strategic lead on high-profile projects, team management, meeting preparation and hiring of key personnel.
‣ 	Highlighted opportunities and suggested improvements to leadership team.
‣ 	Monitored information flow: acts as a gatekeeper and ensures senior IT leadership involvement in projects and decision making.
‣ 	Created board presentations, documentations and action plans.
‣ 	Represented senior management at a strategic / operational level.
‣ 	Monitored the agile transformation and execution together with the Agile Expert Lead.
‣ 	Monitored the execution of Strategic Programmes together with Portfolio managers.
‣ 	Supported the coordination of the budget forecast together with Finance. 
‣ 	Supported the coordination of the People / Talent agenda together with HR.
profile_positions.title: IT Business Manager

profile_positions.description:
‣ 	Reported on project / budget / risk management / test status to Leadership Team.
‣ 	Defined features to the desired level of detail with a focus on clarifying functional and technical dependencies and which Teams/specialists to involve, together with the Chief Product Owner, Business Analyst, Service Manager and the Test Manager.
‣ 	Supported the Chief Product Owner with communication to stakeholders and Teams.
‣ 	Facilitated periodical problem solving sessions in order to remove impediments and manage technical issues throughout the entire Life Cycle Management process.
‣ 	Supported the Test Manager to define the Feature Test Planning for Dev, Test, Acceptance and Production environments throughout the entire Life Cycle Management process.
profile_positions.title: IT and System Integrator

profile_positions.description:
‣ 	Sounding board on any key IT issues for decisions on development of IT systems/applications.
‣ 	Defined process with milestones and deliverables to develop IT systems/applications.
‣ 	Liaised / aligned with IT department / project leader to guide them towards acceptable end product.
‣ 	Liaised / aligned with business leaders to define business requirements to develop IT systems/applications.
‣ 	Liaised / aligned with selected users to secure IT systems/applications are meeting expectations. 
‣ 	Informed / reported to Group Strategy about progress and results.
‣ 	Presented final IT systems/applications to users.
profile_positions.title: IT Project Manager and Product Owner

profile_positions.description:
Roles & Responsibilities
‣ 	Led and executed all stages of AIESEC’s Global Information System Development Life Cycle to increase usability and functionality for over 100,000+ users.
‣ 	Led the development of a EUR 1.3 Million Global information system project. 
‣ 	Created a change management framework for system integration for 124 countries.
‣ 	Final responsible for AIESEC’s global information systems availability, security, and long-term sustainability. 
‣ 	Managed relationships with IT vendors, including all legal aspects such as negotiations, contracts, pricing, project delivery, service level agreements, and licenses.
‣ 	Negotiated over EUR 1.0M worth of contracts with global IT vendors (Tata Consultancy Services, Tata Communications, Customer Gauge, Google, and Rockstar Development).
‣ 	Managed all legal (Dutch & Global) and legislative items related to information systems including data protection and global information management principles.
‣ 	Leadership & Management Team Member, responsible for all strategic decisions and investments.
profile_positions.title: CIO & Global Vice President of Information Management

profile_positions.description:
Roles & Responsibilities
‣ 	Developed and institutionalized three national volunteer programs in 33 local offices.
‣ 	Managed international business relations with 30 countries.
‣ 	Facilitated functional trainings for over 2,500 student volunteers on sales, product development, and project management.

Achievements
‣ 	170% growth in program sales.
‣ 	Awarded: ING Living Success Award 2012 for most most growth in operations in the network of 120 countries.
‣ 	Awarded: Regional Contribution and Collaboration Award most growth in operations in the Ibero-American Region.
‣ 	Awarded: PwC Financial Sustainability Award for sustainable financial growth in operations.
‣ 	Awarded: Global UBS Excellence Award 2011 for most growth in operations in the network of 120 countries.
profile_positions.title: National Director of Operations

profile_positions.description:
Roles & Responsibilities
‣ 	Established a common framework and processes for the management of IT projects.
‣ 	Created and submitted budget proposals for approval. 
‣ 	Negotiated with partner companies, resellers, distributors, and account managers.
‣ 	Conducted competitor and market analysis.
‣ 	Maintained and grew 30 new & longstanding clients. 
‣ 	Created management tools for Products Storage Tracking, Customers Status Tracking, and Licensing Management;

Achievements
‣ 	Signed contracts and upscaled partnership levels with seven of the most prestigious IT security distributors worldwide (SonicWall MSSP Medallion Partnership, McAfee Elite Partnership, Checkpoint Silver Partnership, Fortinet Premium Partnership, Watchguard Premium Partnership, CISCO Gold Partnership, Networking Security Group MVP Tittle).
‣ 	Surveyed, designed, and developed more than 50 IT project proposals across19 states in Brazil.
‣ 	Resolution of 250 Return Material Authorization Customer Cases;
profile_positions.title: IT Business Analyst and Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
‣ 	Performed various engineering activities such as system configuration, patching, backup & restore, setting firewall rules, DNS, network zones and etc.
‣ 	Managed, controlled and monitored various networks for multiple clients from a SNOC (Security Network Operations Center)
‣ 	Supported onsite installation and configuration of network and security appliances 
‣ 	Managed IT incident handling processes and customer engagement
profile_positions.title: Network and Security engineer

profile_positions.description:
‣ 	Wrote software code and scripts in different programming languages
‣ 	Tested, debugged and maintained softwares and applications 
‣ 	Wrote operational and technical documentation
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer
